20110116035750.000|20110116035752.000|TR0|former House Majority leader on money 
20110116035752.000|20110116035755.000|TR0|laundering and conspiracy charges.  He was 
20110116035755.000|20110116035757.000|TR0|found guilty last November of illegally 
20110116035757.000|20110116035800.000|TR0|funneling corporate money to elect 
20110116035800.000|20110116035802.000|TR0|Republican candidates to the Texas state

20110116035812.000|20110116035815.000|TR0|Rapper 50 Cent is adding stock-picking to 
20110116035815.000|20110116035817.000|TR0|his portfolio.  But he's running into some 
20110116035817.000|20110116035820.000|TR0|potential trouble.  Last weekend, he 
20110116035820.000|20110116035822.000|TR0|promoted a penny stock on Twitter, it's 
20110116035822.000|20110116035825.000|TR0|called H  imports.  MoneyWatch.com points 
20110116035825.000|20110116035827.000|TR0|out that 50 Cent owns about 30 percent of 
20110116035827.000|20110116035830.000|TR0|the company and after his tweet, the stock 
20110116035830.000|20110116035832.000|TR0|price jumped more than 200 percent.  Of 
20110116035832.000|20110116035834.000|TR0|course, promoting a stock you already own 
20110116035834.000|20110116035837.000|TR0|risks violating securities laws, which are 
20110116035837.000|20110116035839.000|TR0|designed to keep insiders from privately 
20110116035839.000|20110116035842.000|TR0|dumping a stock while they promote it 
20110116035842.000|20110116035844.000|TR0|publicly.  Well, 50 Cent later tweeted

20110116035847.000|20110116035849.000|TR0|because in his words, the stock may or may 
20110116035849.000|20110116035852.000|TR0|not be right for you.
20110116035852.000|20110116035854.000|TR0|
20110116035854.000|20110116035857.000|TR0|New California Governor Jerry Brown has a 
20110116035857.000|20110116035859.000|TR0|message for about 48,000 state workers -- 
20110116035859.000|20110116035902.000|TR0|hang up your mobile phone and turn it in 
20110116035902.000|20110116035904.000|TR0|to your boss.  Brown has ordered 
20110116035904.000|20110116035907.000|TR0|supervisors to deactivate about half of 
20110116035907.000|20110116035909.000|TR0|all state employees' cell phones by June.  
20110116035909.000|20110116035911.000|TR0|About 96,000 California state workers 
20110116035911.000|20110116035914.000|TR0|currently use cell phones paid for by 
20110116035914.000|20110116035916.000|TR0|taxpayers.  Brown says the cutback will 
20110116035916.000|20110116035919.000|TR0|save the state $20 million a year.  
20110116035919.000|20110116035921.000|TR0|California faces a $25 billion budget 
20110116035921.000|20110116035924.000|TR0|shortfall over the next 18 months.
